intro: Psychotria strigosa, commonly known as the roughleaf Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant features small, elliptical leaves that are covered in fine, stiff hairs, giving it a rough texture. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, with five petals and a prominent, showy stamen. Psychotria strigosa is often found in understory habitats of tropical forests, contributing to the complex ecological interactions within these ecosystems.
